alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:34AM EST until January 12 at 10:18PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Oglethorpe Counties. Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Wilkinson, Baldwin and Washington Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Moderate flooding expands. Several farm access roads begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Wednesday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.2 feet on 12/16/1972. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EST.
